com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.spibus

Interface SPIBus


  • public interface SPIBus
    This interface provides access to the SPI bus that is connected to a device. SPI provides a means of sending and receiving small packets of bytes in a serial manner with a 25Khz clock. Intended devices are HR4000, QE65000, USB2000+, HR2000+, USB4000, USB2000, USB325, USB650

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getSPIBytes(byte[] message, int length)
      Sends a packet of bytes over the SPI bus and read the result.

    • Method Detail

      • getSPIBytes

        byte[] getSPIBytes(byte[] message,
                   int length)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a packet of bytes over the SPI bus and read the result. The underlying command is expected to be OP_SPIREAD (0x62) for the HR4000, HR2000+, QE65000, USB2000 and similar. Note that the SPI bus clocks in a byte for every byte written. That is, if this sends out 10 bytes, then it also receives 10. It is up to the user to know what the device on the SPI bus expects.
        Parameters:
        message - Sequence of bytes to send over the bus. Present implementation in Spectrometer limits SPI messages to 62 bytes (OP_SPIWRITE, length, and 62 message bytes for a total of 64). Bytes in excess may be ignored, depending on the implementation.
        length - of message.
        Returns:
        After writing to SPI, the spectrometer immediately reads from it. The resulting Byte array is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the command cannot be sent to the device.
